section.title: Howdy!
section.para: Howdy! My name is Dray Luckadoo and this book is all about me. Feel free to use this book as an example for your own book, and don't forget: always ask questions!

Some quick facts about me:
I graduated from the University of Texas at Austin in 2019 with a bachelors in Physics and another bachelors in Astronomy.
I have worked full time at Nokia since July 2018, first as a Co-op, and then later as a regular employee.
My full name is Denver Ray Luckadoo III, but my parents gave me the unofficial official name "Dray", and I've gone by it since I was born.
You can call me whatever you'd like, though.

chapter.title: Hobbies of mine
chapter.para: This chapter will list a hobbies that I like to pursue in my free time.

section.title: Motorcycling
section.para: My newest hobby is motorcycle riding. I've always loved the idea of traveling on two wheels, but I've always been wary of the inherent danger. Despite my mom's best wishes, I bought a bright red 2019 Kawasaki Ninja 400 right before the quarantine began and have since put down over 2000 miles. I've only traveled in Texas so far, but I hope to one day get my Iron Butt motorcycling patch (you must travel 1000 miles in 24 hours or less!). I'd also like to eventually get into club racing, hence my choice of beginner motorcycle.

section.title: Music
section.para:
Perhaps my oldest hobby, I love all kinds of music. My first musical passion was guitar and classic rock. In high-school, I played saxophone and competed in Jazz competitions. In college, I really branched out, picking up a strong taste for hip-hop, heavy metal, and old-school country. Recent bands I've been enjoying
Band Genre Short Description
Spillage Village Hip Hop Great hip hop group supergroup comprised of some of my favorite underground rappers. In my opinion, their album Bears Like This Too Much is a borderline classic.
Sleep Stoner Metal Sleep is a slow driving, riff heavy stoner metal band from the 90s. They had this big album controversy in the late 90s and wound up disappearing after their album came out in 2003, but they've recently released a new album The Sciences through Jack White's label Third Man Records that I've been very excited about.
Sturgill Simpson Country Country doesn't really fully describe Sturgill Simpson. He's a bit of a psychedelic take on the old tropes of country music, and I just very much enjoy everything about his work. Specifically, Turtles All the Way Down is a great track.
King Krule Calm? 6 Feet Beneath the Moon is my jam.
Die Antwoord Hip Hop South African hip hop group Die Antwoord... what can I say? They're strange, but catchy. Either love it or hate it, but either way, I enjoy them.

section.title: Hiking
section.para: I love the great outdoors. The fresh air, the solitude, the exercise. After spending so much time at a computer creating documentation, it feels so good to step away and find a good trail. As much as I love hiking, I definitely don't get to do it nearly as much as I'd like. Maybe someday I'll live closer to mountains and I'll become a true master of walking in nature, but until then, I'll do what I can.
